definitions.definition: (often in the plural) In general, a product of plant growth useful to man or animals.

Specifically, a sweet, edible part of a plant that resembles seed-bearing fruit (see next sense), even if it does not develop from a floral ovary; also used in a technically imprecise sense for some sweet or sweetish vegetables, such as the petioles of rhubarb, that resemble a true fruit or are used in cookery as if they were a fruit.
A product of fertilization in a plant, specifically:
An end result, effect, or consequence; advantageous or disadvantageous result.
definitions.example: His long nights in the office eventually bore fruit when his business boomed and he was given a raise.

definitions.definition: Of, belonging to, related to, or having fruit or its characteristics; (of living things) producing or consuming fruit.
definitions.example: the fresh-squeezed fruit juice; a fruit salad; an artificial fruit flavor; a fruit tree; a fruit bat

definitions.definition: A homosexual man; an effeminate man.

definitions.example: Blessed art thou amongst women and blessed is the fruit of thy womb.

definitions.definition: To produce fruit, seeds, or spores.
